Not long after, it stopped charging completely.Aside from the hardware issues, I strongly disliked the robot voice that would aggressively alert me that the volume was at it?s max. It was louder than the music itself, which was allegedly at ?MAXIMUM VOLUME.? I almost recommend this product just for you all to see how terrible that feature alone is.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
review_title: Aux Jack has poor connection and keeps cutting out audio
comment: This is the second Bluetooth adapter I?ve used for my car, and after only using it for a couple of weeks it?s already having issues. The audio keeps cutting out frequently for a couple of seconds at a time which was never an issue with my previous adapter. It seems like the auxiliary jack has a poor connection with the auxiliary input, and it seems like maybe it?s getting loose and losing contact causing the breaks in audio. I?ve tried shifting it around but the issue continues. I?m using the short adapter instead of the longer cable, which I would prefer not to use since it?s less convenient to access while driving. Everything else about it works fine.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
review_title: Another Robot That Wants To Talk Too Much
comment: I can never endorse one of these devices that thinks it needs to talk to you.  This one tells you that the volume is at Minimum when I mute the source.  It YELLS at me when it thinks I've reached maximum volume.  Why robots think we care about stuff like minimum/maximum volume is beyond me, but don't yell at me about it.  Why not just accept the fact I muted the volume without announcing it to me.  Ditto if I turn the volume up too loud - if you can't handle the stronger signal then just don't handle it.  For all the tech designers that think machines need to advise us of mundane facts, please, please, realize we don't care.  These machines that think they can talk really need to learn they're wrong.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
comment: Charged it up and plugged it in. It was easy to connect, and worked great for an hour. Then it died and showed no signs of life again.Will update if the replacement lasts longer, but it was very disappointing.Update: I did receive a replacement.  It seemed to work fine, but there was a persistent whine.  It seems to be a ground problem. No problem, since it's charged it will run on the battery for hoursNOPE! It completely dies when unplugged. Not as described.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
comment: Honestly, it's been good most of the time and given versatility that my current car stereo doesn't have BUT the times it shorts out just make it such a pain.I've used the provided 3.5mm connection and other cables and both cause shorts. The device will have to be positioned just right but if it gets bumped or the car jostles a bit the device volume drops by 50-75%.Another drawback is regarding the charging. Like other users have mentioned, there is a horrible sound it makes when the device is charging if the stereo is on (music playing or not).

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
comment: Worked ok.  I had to always turn it off...then on whenever I got into my vehicle.  Then I had to always turn my bluetooth off on my phone after getting out of my vehicle otherwise it would keep playing.But, I was ok with that as long as it was working....then it stopped working after less than 3 months.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
comment: This bluetooth device caused me immense anger. When I drive my car, I expect to feel like a pop star. Driving down the freeway, windows down, wind in my hair, music blasting, as I sing the victorious soundtrack. I purchased this bluetooth device to be my DJ and unfortunately, it quickly became a pain in the butt. This thing turns on and off as it pleases, and rarely works, similar to a teenage boy. There are times that it just will not connect to my phone no matter how long I try. When my phone is connected, it works great, its the bluetooth connection that is an issue. Honestly, I would splurge and get a nicer one, this isn't worth the money.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
review_title: Radio comes through well, but not phone sound
comment: I bought this for the car I use to travel to customers.  XM come through clear from my phone, but when you try to talk to people through the devise, it sounds like you are MILES away.  Not great.

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
comment: Turns on and connects to phone easily, but the connection sound staticky at times and I often have to hold the device in place if I want to listen. Would recommend for the fast connectivity if not for the lack of a stable connection. I think the aux connection is a bit broken, though I had the device for less than a week

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free

product_name: Upgraded Bluetooth Cancelling Headphones Hands Free
comment: I bought a this item January 2022 & it?s been mostly pretty decent with decent sound quality with one exception. The first of my two issues is that I can here some low level squealing, some days it gets pretty annoying and I just give up and switch to radio. The second issue is recently (August 2022) the device refuses to power on and I?m unable to use it? a few days go by and then it will turn on again. If I could resolve the noise bleeding through and have it power on reliabily I would use it none stop. It?s honestly not to bad when using it for phone calls.PS: the aux-cable seems to work better than the solid plug (less squealing). It would also be cool if these came with some Velcro to help install it onto the dash.
